board

Class board

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.board

  • public class board
extends java.lang.Object
    Board class is the data structure holds all the pieces, manage pieces' movement and updates pieces movements when a turn is over
    Author:
    Jami Nicastro and Ran Sa

    • Field Summary

      board()
      create all the pieces for black and white and store them in their corresponding aray

      • setFlag

        public void setFlag(int color,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        Set enpass flage for the pawn that can be enpassed
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the pawn, 0 for black 1 for white
        x - the position of the pawn on the x axis
        y - the position of the pawn on the y axis

      • getFlag

        public int[] getFlag()
        Getter method for the enpass flage
        Returns:
        an array of enpass flage in the form of {white-x,white-y,black-x,black-y}

      • get

        public piece[][] get()
        Getter method for the 2D array
        Returns:
        the 2D array that used as a chess board

      • setIndex

        public void setIndex(int color,
                     int i,
                     piece p)
        Add a piece to its corresponding array
        Parameters:
        color - the color of the piece 0 for black 1 for white
        i - the index of the array that user want to add the new piece to
        p - the piece that will be added

        Get a piece which is on (x,y) from the chess board

        y - the y aixs of the piece that the user want to get
        Returns:
        the piece that the user want to get

      • recycle

        public void recycle(int x,
                    int y)
        when a piece is attacked, delete this piece from the chess board and the array that is holding it
        Parameters:
        x - x axis of the piece that want to be deleted
        y - y axis of the piece that want to be deleted

      • update

        public void update()
        After a turn is finished, update the chess board based on pieces' (x,y) value

      • occupied

        public boolean occupied(int x,
                        int y)
        check a specific position on the board to see if there is a piece on it
        Parameters:
        x - the x axis value of the position that wanted to be checked
        y - the x axis value of the position that wanted to be checked
        Returns:
        return true if there is a piece on the place false otherwise

      • getColor

        public int getColor(int x,
                    int y)
        check a if it is dark tile or a white tile
        Parameters:
        x - the x axis value of the position that wanted to be checked
        y - the y axis value of the position that wanted to be checked
        Returns:
        0 for black and 1 for white

      • convert

        public int[] convert(java.lang.String p)
        covert chess board location to 2D array position for example a1 to (0,7)
        Parameters:
        p - the chess board position as a string
        Returns:
        an array length of two that stores the x and y value

      • reconvert

        public java.lang.String reconvert(int sx,
                                  int sy,
                                  int ex,
                                  int ey)
        convert 2D array position to chess board location for example (0,7) to a1
        Parameters:
        sx - initial x axis value of the position
        sy - initial y axis value of the position
        ex - final x axis value of the position
        ey - final y axis value of the position
        Returns:
        return a string in chess board loaction

      • inputCheck

        public int[] inputCheck(java.lang.String in,
                        int co)
        check if the input is legal
        Parameters:
        in - the input as a String
        co - which one's turn, 1 for white and 0 for black
        Returns:
        return an array of chess board position if valid return null when not valid At the end of the array 0 normal move 1 resign 2 request draw 3 confirm draw 4 promote to knight 5 to queen 6 bishop 7 rook

      • check

        public boolean check(int c)
        check if the king is in check position
        Parameters:
        c - the color of the king that want to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the king is in check position, false otherwise

      • checkhealper

        Parameters:
        x - x axis value of the position of the king
        y - y axis value of the position of the king
        c - color of the king
        Returns:
        true if the king is in check position, false otherwise
